questions.text: In what country were Donald Duck comics banned?
questions.explanation:
Finland.

	The Finns didn't like the fact that Donald didn't wear pants.

questions.text: Most lipsticks contain something from the sea. What is it?
questions.explanation:
Fish scales.

	What a glamourous thought!

questions.text: Where did the Caesar salad originate?
questions.explanation:
Tijuana, Mexico.

	It was first concocted in a bar in Mexico in the 1920s.

questions.text: What football team was the first to introduce emblems on their helmets?

questions.explanation:
December 26.

	December 26 is also called 'Boxing Day' in the U.K. and Canada. Mike Tyson's favorite holiday, I hear!

questions.text: Who narrated the popular children's movie, 'Milo and Otis'?
questions.explanation:
Dudley Moore.

	Dudley was born in London, England on April 19, 1935.

questions.text: What is the busiest port in the U.S.?
questions.explanation:
Port of South Louisiana.

	Louisiana's nickname is the Pelican State.

questions.text: Who wrote the children's classic, 'The Ugly Duckling'?
questions.explanation:
Hans Christian Andersen.

	Danish author Andersen also wrote, 'The Princess and the Pea'. The others are all known for writing classics for children too.

questions.text: Which language is spoken by the most native speakers?
questions.explanation:
Mandarin.

	I'll take a pint of Wonton and three shrimp rolls to go, please.

questions.text: How many countries are members of the United Nations in September of 1998?
questions.explanation:
185.

	Fun fact: Afghanistan joined in 1946. So maybe the Ununited Nations might be a more fitting name.
